title: Panic as car drives between security bollards at Arsenal’s Emirates Stadium
text:
A man is questioned and searched ahead of the Premier League match at the Emirates Stadium (Picture: Paul Terry/Sportimage)

Football fans were cleared from the front of Arsenal’s Emirates stadium this afternoon after a car careered between security bollards an hour before the Gunners took on Crystal Palace

Police evacuated the area around The Armoury and arrested the 23-year-old driver of the blue Nissan as tens of thousands of supporters made their way to the ground for the kick off.

It’s thought a sniffer dog was used to check the vehicle as police questioned the suspect.

The Metropolitan Police confirmed the incident was not terrorism related while an Arsenal FC spokesman said the match would go ahead as planned.

The force tweeted: ‘Reports circulating of vehicle targeting pedestrians earlier today near Emirates Stadium are false.’

They said the driver was stopped after striking a few cones and that no one was arrested.
